page.title: 01WARDOUR DISTRICT
page.content: {Wardour}is part of the{Nadder Valley. The{River Nadder,}which flows through Wardour,joins the{River Avon}at {Salisbury . Most of the land is{farmland and fields and{woodland }.In our area there is only one{ village }called {Ansty,}and there are two{hamlets,Hatch and{Wardour.}There is an{old castle that is open to the public.There is a {new castle}which is now a school.Part of the new castle is a{chapel.}It is a very beautiful chapel,built in 1776. There is a{primary school}in{Wardour. There are lots of{wild animals}such as foxes,badgers,deer,pheasents,rabbits, etc,but,not many people!There were more people here a{hundred years ago. {Laura}and{Victoria
